page.title: 09TELEPHONE AND POST
page.content: More than{90%}of households in Lismore have{telephones.}This is not so with holiday houses. There are{5 {public telephone boxes. The{post office}is in the middle of the island. The shopkeeper is the postmaster.He gives out{pensions}and sells{postal orders. { Mail}comes from{Oban}by{MacBrayne boat to{Achnachroish}at{9.30.}It is taken by the postman in a van to the post office and{sorted.}It is then {delivered}by van. The postman has to {walk}to houses with{no road,}and may take mail from outlying houses to be posted. There are{5 post boxes}to be collected. { Outgoing mail}is taken to the post office,{postmarked,}bagged and taken to the pier for the{3.45 boat}for Oban. There it is sorted to take the {6 o'clock train}out of Oban.
